Rebut.origin: [Anglo-French reboter rebuter to answer a charge, bar from an action, literally, to repulse, rebuff, from Old French reboter , from re- back + boter to push, butt]

re·but·ting.definition: [Anglo-Frenchto answer a charge, bar from an action, literally, to repulse, rebuff, from Old French, fromback +to push, butt]to refute, counteract, or disprove (as opposing evidence) by evidence or argument [ damaging testimony] [ a presumption]
